result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa J Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is to be paid to the Walmart listed in the criminal complaint and to be paid BEFORE costs or fines.

Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with the Walmart listed in the criminal complaint or the co-actor.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with Standard Release conditions - STAYED.
To be used at the discretion of the Agent.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lisa J Brown in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  

State moves to amend the charge to a misdemeanor from a felony.
State files an amended information.

Defendant enter a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.



Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Concurrent to any other sentence.
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Wal-Mart listed in the criminal complaint or co-actor.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.


RESTITUTION:  $436.66 (to be paid to Wal-Mart listed in the criminal complaint - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED.
To be used at the discretion of the agent.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke in court.   
Defendant Lisa J Brown did not appear (unable to get here).

Atty. Redetzke presented statements to the court.
Court stays a warrant to the next court date.
MANDATORY APPEARANCE IS REQUIRED.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
